alert.note: Alert for Grimes; Montgomery; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GRIMES... NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...WEST CENTRAL MONTGOMERY AND NORTHEASTERN WALLER COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Navasota, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Navasota, Pinehurst, Magnolia, Todd Mission, Plantersville, and Dobbin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
